verses.verse: (Job: My Suffering Is without End) (Job 10.17; 14.6, 14; Isa 40.2) “Do not human beings have a hard service on earth, and are not their days like the days of a laborer?
(Lev 19.13) Like a slave who longs for the shadow, and like laborers who look for their wages,
(Ps 6.6; Lam 1.7) so I am allotted months of emptiness, and nights of misery are apportioned to me.
(Deut 28.67) When I lie down I say, ‘When shall I rise?’ But the night is long, and I am full of tossing until dawn.
My flesh is clothed with worms and dirt; my skin hardens, then breaks out again.
(Job 9.25; 13.15; 17.15, 16) My days are swifter than a weaver’s shuttle and come to their end without hope. (Or as the thread runs out)
(Job 9.25; Ps 78.39) “Remember that my life is a breath; my eye will never again see good.
(v 21|JOB 7:21; Job 20.9) The eye that beholds me will see me no more; while your eyes are upon me, I shall be gone.
(2 Sam 12.23; Job 11.8; 30.15) As the cloud fades and vanishes, so those who go down to Sheol do not come up;
(Job 10.21; Ps 103.16) they return no more to their houses, nor do their places know them any more.
(1 Sam 1.10; Ps 40.9) “Therefore I will not restrain my mouth; I will speak in the anguish of my spirit; I will complain in the bitterness of my soul.
(Ezek 32.2, 3) Am I the Sea or the Dragon that you set a guard over me?
When I say, ‘My bed will comfort me, my couch will ease my complaint,’
(Job 9.34) then you scare me with dreams and terrify me with visions,
so that I would choose strangling and death rather than this body.
(Job 10.1; Eccl 7.15) I loathe my life; I would not live forever. Let me alone, for my days are a breath.
(Ps 8.4; 144.3; Heb 2.6) What are humans, that you make so much of them, that you set your mind on them,
visit them every morning, test them every moment?
Will you not look away from me for a while, let me alone until I swallow my spittle?
(v 12|JOB 7:12; Job 16.12; 35.3, 6) If I sin, what do I do to you, you watcher of humanity? Why have you made me your target? Why have I become a burden to you?
(v 8|JOB 7:8; Job 10.14; Ps 104.29) Why do you not pardon my transgression and take away my iniquity? For now I shall lie in the earth; you will seek me, but I shall not be.”
